page.title: 08Shepshed Parish Council
page.content: The{parish council}is made up of fifteen people from{Shepshed}who were elected by local people. It gets money for its work from{rates.}On average each household pays 25 pence per week. This money should be spent on what the townspeople want. All parish councils are responsible for{parks, cemeteries, allotments, {litter bins, bus stops and public {seats.}The Shepshed parish council has been in existence for{three years,}and in that time they have tried to make life in Shepshed more pleasant. They are very proud of the{B.M.X. track that they helped to build. They also employ a{full-time road sweeper}to keep the town clean. They organise a {community centre}to help local people, and their future plans include making the park a safer place for children to play.
